questions.question: I will not come …………………… he invites me.
questions.description: Except is not equivalent to unless. Unless means if not.

questions.question: Put everything …………………… the vase in the box.
questions.description: Except is a preposition. It means excluding or other than.

questions.question: I will not go ……………………….. you do.
questions.description: Unless is not equivalent to without.

questions.question: He walks ……………………….. his father does.
questions.description: Like is a preposition as is a conjunction. We need a conjunction to connect two clauses.

questions.question: ……………………….. he had gone, cops knocked at the door.
questions.description: As soon as is used to connect two actions that happen in quick succession.

questions.question: ……………………….. had he gone, when someone knocked at the door.
questions.description: We use an inverted word order after hardly and scarcely.

questions.question: No sooner had he returned from the city ………………………… he started feeling ill.
questions.description: No sooner is followed by than.

questions.question: He was buried in the village …………………………… he was born.
He washed ………………………… his hands nor his face.
I have eaten nothing ………………………… I left home.
questions.description: Since can refer to time. It indicates the starting point of something.
